location_brief_en: Gaurikund — high Himalayan valley near Mandakini river.
origin_story_en: Ancient Shiva shrine tied to Pandavas seeking atonement; one of twelve Jyotirlingas.
origin_story_hi: पांडवों से जुड़ा प्राचीन शिव मंदिर; बारह ज्योतिर्लिंगों में से एक।
significance_en: Major Shaiva pilgrimage; central to Himalayan spiritual traditions.
rituals_en: Daily puja, Mahashivaratri special rituals; seasonal opening & closing ceremonies.
festivals_en: Mahashivaratri; local shrine festivals during opening (May–June).
best_time_en: May to October (temple accessible; winter closes due to snow).
spiritual_meaning_en: Inner purification through hardship; surrender to Shiva's primacy.
shloka_sanskrit: न हि कश्चित् कर्मफलत्यागं तत्त्वतः प्रवर्तते।
shloka_translation_en: True renunciation of fruit of action is rare (guide to detachment).

location_brief_en: Alaknanda valley near Mana village, high Himalaya.
origin_story_en: Associated with Vishnu; seat of Badrinarayan worship established by Adi Shankaracharya.
significance_en: One of the 108 Divya Desams and the Char Dham pilgrimage for Vaishnavas.
rituals_en: Daily aarti, special alankara on festival days, winter closure rituals.
festivals_en: Brahmotsavam, Badri-Kedar mela, Janmashtami celebrations.
best_time_en: May to November (when temple is open).
spiritual_meaning_en: Devotion to Vishnu and the path of bhakti in remote austerity.
shloka_translation_en: May all be happy — a universal benediction often recited in temples.

location_brief_en: Source region of Bhagirathi River (Ganga headwaters).
origin_story_en: Commemorates goddess Ganga's descent; myth of Bhagiratha's penance.
significance_en: Pilgrimage to the Ganga source; strong purification symbolism.
rituals_en: Puja to Ganga Devi; offerings and sacrificial rites at ghats.
festivals_en: Ganga Dussehra, special rituals during pilgrimage season.
spiritual_meaning_en: Purification and spiritual rebirth through Ganga waters.
shloka_translation_en: Hail Mother Ganga — invocation for purifier of sins.

location_brief_en: Headwaters of Yamuna near Bandarpoonch range.
origin_story_en: Dedicated to goddess Yamuna; associated with Yamaraja legends.
significance_en: Important for river-worship and Himalayan pilgrimage circuits.
rituals_en: Hot spring ablutions (Surya Kund), daily worship in season.
festivals_en: Yamuna Jayanti and seasonal temple festivals.
spiritual_meaning_en: Flow of life and time; river as both nurturer and ascetic force.
shloka_translation_en: That great river — reverence for Yamuna's sacredness.

location_brief_en: Dwarka city on Gujarat coast — ancient Krishna kingdom site.
origin_story_en: Seat of Lord Krishna post-Dwaraka legends; one of the Char Dhams.
significance_en: Major Vaishnava pilgrimage; maritime temple with strong Puranic links.
rituals_en: Daily darshan, pujas, and Rath Yatra-style processions.
festivals_en: Janmashtami, Holi, and Krishna-related festivals.
spiritual_meaning_en: Bhakti to Krishna and the ideal of divine kingship.
shloka_translation_en: Salutations to Krishna, lord of the world.

location_brief_en: Puri on Bay of Bengal; crowning shrine of Jagannath cult.
origin_story_en: Associated with Vishnu in form of Jagannath; deep tribal and temple synthesis.
significance_en: Famous for annual Rath Yatra; major Char Dham site.
rituals_en: Daily sevas, elaborate kitchen (Mahaprasad) rituals, chariot procession.
festivals_en: Rath Yatra (massive chariot festival) is central.
best_time_en: October to February (pleasant season); Rath Yatra in June/July.
spiritual_meaning_en: Universal accessibility of the divine; intense communal devotion.
shloka_translation_en: Salutations to Lord Jagannath.

location_brief_en: Island town at southern tip of India; connected with Ramayana.
origin_story_en: Shiva worshipped by Lord Rama after Lanka war; linked to Rama's atonement.
significance_en: One of twelve Jyotirlingas; southern Char Dham tradition includes it.
rituals_en: Puja, narrow corridors of pradakshina (circumambulation), holy dips.
festivals_en: Mahashivaratri, Ram Navami observances.
spiritual_meaning_en: Atonement, restoration, and the union of Vedic and epic traditions.
shloka_translation_en: Rama is that which brings delight — an invocation of Rama's grace.

location_brief_en: Coastal Gujarat; famed for repeated reconstructions across centuries.
origin_story_en: One of the earliest Jyotirlinga sites; associated with moon-god legends.
significance_en: Symbol of resilience; important Shaiva center and pilgrimage stop.
rituals_en: Daily puja, grand festivals marking temple anniversary.
festivals_en: Mahashivaratri and temple consecration days.
spiritual_meaning_en: Renewal and continuity of devotion despite worldly upheavals.
shloka_translation_en: Homage to the Moon-lord in classical invocations.

location_brief_en: Varanasi (Kashi) on Ganga; one of the most revered Shiva shrines.
origin_story_en: Ancient center of Shaiva worship; Varanasi's mythology ties Shiva's empowerment here.
significance_en: Spiritual heart for liberation (moksha) seekers; major pilgrimage hub.
rituals_en: Aarti on Ganga ghats, daily temple sevas, special Shraddha rituals.
festivals_en: Mahashivaratri, Ganga aarti festivals.
spiritual_meaning_en: City of liberation — death in Kashi is traditionally believed to grant moksha.
shloka_translation_en: Shiva abides in Kashi — the city is his abode.

location_brief_en: Cave shrine in Trikuta Hills near Katra.
origin_story_en: Shrine of the goddess (a form of Durga/Tridevi) with folk and tantric origins.
significance_en: One of India's foremost Shakti pilgrimages; millions of devotees annually.
rituals_en: Cave darshan, ceremonial offerings, seasonal fairs.
festivals_en: Navaratri and festival peak seasons attract large pilgrim flows.
best_time_en: March to November (winter can be harsh on hill paths).
spiritual_meaning_en: Mother goddess blessing, protection and fulfillment of devotees' vows.
shloka_translation_en: Hail Mother Vaishno Devi.

location_brief_en: Tirumala hills above Tirupati city; extremely popular Vaishnava shrine.
origin_story_en: Venkateswara is seen as a form of Vishnu who grants material and spiritual blessings.
significance_en: One of the richest and busiest pilgrimage centers in the world.
rituals_en: Daily seva, tons of rituals for hundi offerings, special alankarams.
festivals_en: Brahmotsavam (major annual festival), Vaikuntha Ekadashi.
best_time_en: September to March (festival calendar and pleasant weather).
spiritual_meaning_en: Devotion, surrender and the idea of grace yielding worldly & spiritual welfare.
shloka_translation_en: Salutations to Lord Venkateswara.

location_brief_en: Historic city of Ujjain; one of twelve Jyotirlingas.
origin_story_en: Ancient Shaiva shrine associated with time (Mahakala) and ritual power.
significance_en: Important center for Shaiva tantra and classical worship practices.
rituals_en: Bhasma aarti (ash-aarti) unique to Mahakaleshwar; day/night rituals.
festivals_en: Mahashivaratri, Kumbh events when held at Ujjain.
spiritual_meaning_en: Confrontation with time and death — liberation through Shiva as Mahakala.
shloka_translation_en: Salutations to the Great Time (Mahakala).

location_brief_en: Coast of Odisha; 13th-century monumental temple to Surya.
origin_story_en: Built as a colossal chariot of the Sun; fusion of art and devotion.
significance_en: Architectural and ritual center; solar cult and cultural heritage site.
rituals_en: Historical observances; modern cultural festivals and sun-related rituals.
festivals_en: Konark Dance Festival (cultural); Makar Sankranti observances.
best_time_en: October to March (cultural season and mild weather).
spiritual_meaning_en: Sun as visible expression of divine energy and cosmic order.
shloka_translation_en: Salutations to the Lord of dawn (sun).

location_brief_en: High-altitude cave with natural ice Shivling; remote Himalayan route.
origin_story_en: Associated with Shiva revealing immortality (Amar Katha) to Parvati.
significance_en: Major annual yatra; strong ascetic and pilgrimage emphasis.
rituals_en: Seasonal yatra rituals and cave worship; cremation and offerings in base camps.
festivals_en: Amarnath Yatra season (summer months).
best_time_en: June to August (yatra window, dependent on weather).
spiritual_meaning_en: Impermanence vs. immortality — Shiva's teaching on cosmic truth.
shloka_translation_en: Where immortality is taught — reference to the cave's tradition.

location_brief_en: Southernmost tip of India; coastal shrine of the virgin goddess.
origin_story_en: Goddess Parvati in maiden form halted at southern tip; mixed temple & coastal traditions.
significance_en: Shakti worship and coastal pilgrimage; sunrise/sunset spiritual symbolism.
rituals_en: Daily puja, coastal rites and local festivals honoring the goddess.
festivals_en: Navaratri and Makar Sankranti related observances.
spiritual_meaning_en: Confluence of land, sea and devotion — boundary as sacred threshold.
shloka_translation_en: Salutations to the virgin Goddess.

location_brief_en: Historic Krishna temple in Kerala with strong devotional community.
origin_story_en: Ancient installation of Krishna image brought by temple patrons.
significance_en: Highly revered in South Indian Vaishnava practice; devotional music traditions.
rituals_en: Abhishekam, elephant processions, and temple arts performances.
festivals_en: Guruvayur Ekadasi and temple annual festivities.
spiritual_meaning_en: Bhakti and temple art as a means of devotion and community bonding.
shloka_translation_en: I bow to Vasudeva (Krishna).

location_brief_en: Representative coastal temple tradition; regional Shaiva/Vaishnava fusion.
origin_story_en: Local dynastic patronage with syncretic devotional practices.
significance_en: Shows regional temple forms supporting pilgrim networks.
rituals_en: Local sevas, annual chariot and arts festivals.
festivals_en: Regional temple festivals (e.g., annual Brahmotsavam).
spiritual_meaning_en: Regional devotional expression and continuity of folk traditions.
shloka_translation_en: I bow to your lotus feet — common devotional phrase.

location_brief_en: High hill temple representing many Himalayan shrines.
origin_story_en: Local legend blends local deities with Puranic gods.
significance_en: Represents many small but important mountain shrines that shape pilgrimage ecology.
rituals_en: Seasonal fairs, village-led rituals, simple aartis and offerings.
festivals_en: Local mela weeks and harvest festivals.
spiritual_meaning_en: Locally rooted devotion and the meeting of folk & classical Hinduism.
shloka_translation_en: Salutations to the guardian deity of the place.

location_brief_en: Placeholder for smaller but culturally important temples across India.
origin_story_en: Often founded by local saints, kings or community devotion.
significance_en: Important for local identity and ritual continuity.
rituals_en: Village rites, annual processions, and community feeding.
festivals_en: Local patron deity festival (name varies by place).
spiritual_meaning_en: Community, continuity, and lived religion.
shloka_translation_en: I remember the community and its sacred forms.

location_brief_en: Supplementary node to complete corpus for RAG.
origin_story_en: Short canonical sketch; add local legends for each node when expanding.
significance_en: Complements Char Dham dataset for coverage.
rituals_en: Seasonal pilgrimage rituals, local rites.
festivals_en: Local seasonal festivals.
spiritual_meaning_en: Pilgrimage, penance, and cultural integration.
shloka_translation_en: Pilgrimage becomes meritorious when undertaken rightly.

location_brief_en: Represents small Shaiva centers across India.
origin_story_en: Often connected to a local saint or mythic event.
significance_en: Supports tantric and Vedic strands within Shaivism.
rituals_en: Abhisheka, Rudra homa and local aartis.
festivals_en: Mahashivaratri, local Shivaratri observances.
spiritual_meaning_en: Inner transformation and confrontation with mortality.
shloka_translation_en: Hail Mahadev — an invocation of Shiva's power.

location_brief_en: Represents temple complexes of South India with Agama tradition.
origin_story_en: Often built by Cholas, Pandyas, Hoysalas with royal patronage.
significance_en: Centers for classical arts, bhakti and temple economics.
rituals_en: Agama-based pujas, music, and nattuvangam performances.
festivals_en: Brahmotsavam and temple-specific celebrations.
spiritual_meaning_en: Integration of arts, devotion and temple economy.
shloka_translation_en: Devotion is the highest austerity.

location_brief_en: Represents historic temple centers of western India.
origin_story_en: Often associated with maritime trade and ancient kingdoms.
significance_en: Pilgrimage, maritime trade culture and temple rebuilding histories.
rituals_en: Regional rituals, coastal observances.
festivals_en: Mahashivratri and local anniversaries.
spiritual_meaning_en: Continuity and resilience of sacred places.
shloka_translation_en: I perform worship of this sacred place.

location_brief_en: Represents Varanasi's cluster of shrines and ghats.
origin_story_en: Varanasi's status as an ancient cultural-spiritual center.
significance_en: Hub for death rites, Vedic learning and temple economy.
rituals_en: Ganga aarti, Shraddha, daily temple sevas.
festivals_en: Kartik, Diwali, Shivaratri events on ghats and temples.
spiritual_meaning_en: Liberation, ancestral rites and continuity of tradition.
shloka_translation_en: Salutation to the sacred city (Kashi).

location_brief_en: Covers tribal-linked shrines and regional pilgrimage networks.
origin_story_en: Often fused tribal and Vedic motifs through centuries of contact.
significance_en: Important for cultural preservation and regional devotional forms.
rituals_en: Local harvest and offering festivals, village rites.
festivals_en: Regional fairs tied to seasons and local deities.
best_time_en: October to March generally suitable for travel.
spiritual_meaning_en: Syncretic devotion and cultural continuity.
shloka_translation_en: Salutations to the deities of the place.

location_brief_en: Meta-node to ensure RAG has pan-Indian coverage for queries.
origin_story_en: Synthesizes canonical summaries and major pilgrimage data.
significance_en: Helps answer queries comparing multiple dham and pilgrimage practices.
rituals_en: Captures core ritual templates across many temples.
festivals_en: Lists major shared festivals: Diwali, Navaratri, Mahashivaratri.
spiritual_meaning_en: Pilgrimage as social and spiritual practice across India.
shloka_translation_en: May righteousness prevail everywhere.
